verses.verse: The burden <S%H4853><s%> of Nineveh <S%H5210><s%>. The book <S%H5612><s%> of the vision <S%H2377><s%> of Nahum <S%H5151><s%> the Elkoshite <S%H512><s%>.

God <S%H410><s%> is jealous <S%H7072><s%>, and the Lord <S%H3068><s%> revenges <S%H5358><s%>; the Lord <S%H3068><s%> revenges <S%H5358><s%>, and is furious <S%H1167><s%>; the Lord <S%H3068><s%> will take vengeance <S%H5358><s%> on his adversaries <S%H6862><s%>, and he reserves <S%H5201><s%> wrath for his enemies <S%H341><s%>.

The Lord <S%H3068><s%> is slow <S%H750><s%> to anger <S%H639><s%>, and great <S%H1419><s%> in power <S%H3581><s%>, and will not at all <S%H5352><s%> acquit <S%H5352><s%> the wicked <S%H3068><s%>: the Lord has his way <S%H1870><s%> in the whirlwind <S%H5492><s%> and in the storm <S%H8183><s%>, and the clouds <S%H6051><s%> are the dust <S%H80><s%> of his feet <S%H7272><s%>.

He rebukes <S%H1605><s%> the sea <S%H3220><s%>, and makes it dry <S%H2717><s%>, and dries up <S%H3001><s%> all the rivers <S%H5104><s%>: Bashan <S%H1316><s%> languishes <S%H535><s%>, and Carmel <S%H3760><s%>, and the flower <S%H6525><s%> of Lebanon <S%H3844><s%> languishes <S%H535><s%>.

The mountains <S%H2022><s%> quake <S%H7493><s%> at him <S%H1389><s%>, and the hills melt <S%H4127><s%>, and the earth <S%H776><s%> is burned <S%H5375><s%> at his presence <S%H6440><s%>, Yes <S%H8398><s%>, the world, and all that live in it <S%H3427><s%>.

Who can stand <S%H5975><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> his indignation <S%H2195><s%>? and who can stay <S%H6965><s%> in the fierceness <S%H2740><s%> of his anger <S%H639><s%>? his fury <S%H2534><s%> is poured out <S%H5413><s%> like fire <S%H784><s%>, and the rocks <S%H6697><s%> are thrown down by him <S%H5422><s%>.
The Lord <S%H3068><s%> is good <S%H2896><s%>, a strong hold <S%H4581><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> of trouble <S%H6869><s%>; and he knows <S%H3045><s%> them that trust in him <S%H2620><s%>.

But with a overrunning <S%H5674><s%> flood <S%H7858><s%> he will make <S%H6213><s%> a utter end <S%H3617><s%> of the place <S%H4725><s%> there <S%H2822><s%>, and darkness shall pursue <S%H7291><s%> his enemies <S%H341><s%>.

What do you imagine <S%H2803><s%> against the Lord <S%H3068><s%>? he will make <S%H6213><s%> a utter end <S%H3617><s%>: affliction <S%H6869><s%> shall not rise up <S%H6965><s%> the second time <S%H6471><s%>.

For while they be folden together <S%H5440><s%> as thorns <S%H5518><s%>, and while they are drunken <S%H5433><s%> as drunkards <S%H5435><s%>, they shall be devoured <S%H398><s%> as stubble <S%H7179><s%> fully <S%H4392><s%> dry <S%H3002><s%>.
There is one come out <S%H3318><s%> of you <S%H2803><s%>, that imagines evil <S%H7451><s%> against the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, a wicked <S%H1100><s%> counselor <S%H3289><s%>.

Thus says <S%H559><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%>; Though they be quiet <S%H8003><s%>, and likewise many <S%H7227><s%>, yet thus shall they be cut down <S%H1494><s%>, when he shall pass through <S%H5674><s%>. Though I have afflicted <S%H6031><s%> you <S%H6031><s%>, I will afflict you no more.
For now will I break <S%H7665><s%> his yoke <S%H4132><s%> from off you <S%H5423><s%>, and will burst your bonds <S%H4147><s%> in pieces <S%H5423><s%>.

And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> has given a commandment <S%H6680><s%> concerning you <S%H8034><s%>, that no more of your name be sown <S%H2232><s%>: out of the house <S%H1004><s%> of your gods <S%H430><s%> will I cut off <S%H3772><s%> the engraved image <S%H6459><s%> and the molten image <S%H4541><s%>: I will make <S%H7760><s%> your grave <S%H6913><s%>; for you are vile <S%H7043><s%>.

Behold upon the mountains <S%H2022><s%> the feet <S%H7272><s%> of him that brings good news <S%H1319><s%>, that publishes <S%H8085><s%> peace <S%H7965><s%>! O Judah <S%H3063><s%>, keep <S%H2287><s%> your solemn feasts <S%H2282><s%>, perform <S%H7999><s%> your vows <S%H5088><s%>: for the wicked <S%H1100><s%> shall no more <S%H3254><s%> pass through <S%H5674><s%> you <S%H3772><s%>; he is utterly cut off.
